Forms elements

A form allows visitors to submit information to a server.

Common form elements include:

  • Labels
  • Text fields
  • Text areas
  • Checkboxes
  • Radio buttons
  • Dropdown menus (select)
  • File inputs

Text field

A text field allows visitors to write or edit text. Text field should always have a label that is assosiated with it.

The label should:

  • Describe the purpose of the text field.
  • Use sentence-style capitalization—only capitalize the first word.
  • Be short and concise.
  • Use nouns or short noun phrases.
  • Inform visitors whether or not the form input is required (represented by an asterisk).
  • Avoid instructional text like "Click to get started".

Additional instructions or error messages can be incorporated below the text field.

  • Example
  • Source code
Example

Default

Use this space for error messages or instruction text

Required

This field is required
Source code 
Default





 Use this space for error messages or instruction text




Required





 This field is required

Text area

A text area allows visitors to write or edit multiple lines of text. Same as text field the text area should always have a label that is assosiated with it.

  • Example
  • Source code
Example

Default

Use this space for error messages or instruction text

Required

This field is required
Source code 
Default



Use this space for error messages or instruction text


Required





 This field is required

Checkbox

A checkbox allows visitors to select one or more options from a number of choices.

  • Example
  • Source code
Example

Which types of waste do you transport?

Select all that apply
Source code 



Which types of waste do you transport?

Select all that apply

Radio button

A radio button allows visitors to select only one option from a number of choices.

  • Example
  • Source code
Example

What is your favorite pet?

Select one
Source code 
What is your favorite pet?

Select one

Dropdown menu

Other names: select

A dropdown menu hides options by default. When interacted with, the dropdown menu displays a list of options visitors may select.

  • Example
  • Source code
Example
Source code

File input

A file input let the user choose one or more files from their device storage. Once chosen, the files can be uploaded to a server using form submission.

  • Example
  • Source code
Example
Feedback text.
